name: Granola
method: Preheat oven to 325˚
Mix together oats, salt and cinnamon
Mix together honey, peanut butter and vanilla extract in a pot over low heat or in the microwave
Combine oat and honey mixtures
place mixture on parchment paper-lined baking sheets and bake for 20 minutes, stirring the mixture halfway through

name: Vegan Fudgesicles
method: Mix all ingredients together in a blender
Pour into popsicle molds
Freeze for at least 4 hours

name: Korean Beef
ingredients: 2 green onions , only the green parts
method: Heat a large pan over medium high heat
Brown the meat with sesame oil, garlic and ginger
Drain 75% of the fat, add brown sugar, soy sauce, and Sriracha
Cook until the liquid has reabsorbed and the meat is shiny but not soupy
Top with green onions, toss together and serve over rice

name: Best Ever Banana Muffins
method: Preheat oven to 375˚ and line a muffin pan with muffin liners
Mash bananas in a large bowl, add sugar slightly beaten egg
Add vegetable oil and dry ingredients to mixture
Mix 1 tbsp of flour to chocolate chips then add them to the mix
Bake 20 minutes

name: Swedish Apple Crisp
method: Preheat oven to 375˚ and butter a 9x9 inch pan
Mix together apples, 1/4 cup sugar, water and cinnamon and place into pan
Mix flour, 1/4 cup sugar, and oats together
Cut margarine into oat mixture and sprinkle over apples
Bake 40-45 minutes
Top with ice cream

name: Emergency Chocolate Cake
method: Preheat oven to 375˚
Combine all ingredients, except vinegar, and whisk until combined
Add vinegar, the batter will fizz, and stir until combined
Bake 25-30 minutes

name: Burgers
ingredients: 1 tsp chili powder OR 1/4 tsp crushed chili peppers
method: Mix all ingredients in large bowl
Shape into patties and grill (or bake in oven 10-20 minutes
Serve with a fresh bun and your choice of condiments

name: Slow-Cooker Applesauce
method: Add all ingredients to slow-cooker and cook on high for 2 hour or on low for 4 hours
You can eat as is or use an immersion blender to make sauce less chunky
